name: Academic Evaluation Criteria
description: Comprehensive criteria for evaluating academic and research content

criteria.name: accuracy
criteria.description: Factual correctness and truthfulness of the response
criteria.evaluation_prompt: Evaluate the factual accuracy of the response. Are the claims correct, well-supported, and verifiable?

examples.1: Contains major factual errors or misinformation
examples.4: Accurate with no significant factual issues
examples.5: Completely accurate and well-supported with evidence

criteria.name: completeness
criteria.evaluation_prompt: Assess how completely the response addresses all aspects of the original question or prompt. Does it cover all necessary points?

examples.1: Addresses very few aspects of the question
examples.2: Covers some but misses important aspects
examples.5: Thoroughly addresses all aspects with appropriate depth

criteria.name: clarity
criteria.description: Clarity of expression and ease of understanding
criteria.evaluation_prompt: Evaluate the clarity and understandability of the response. Is it well-articulated and easy to follow?

examples.1: Confusing, unclear, or difficult to understand
examples.2: Somewhat unclear with areas of confusion
examples.3: Generally clear with minor unclear points

criteria.name: relevance
criteria.description: Relevance to the original prompt or question
criteria.evaluation_prompt: Assess how relevant the response is to the original question or prompt. Does it stay on topic?

examples.2: Somewhat relevant but with significant tangents
examples.5: Perfectly relevant and directly addresses the prompt

criteria.name: helpfulness
criteria.description: Practical value and usefulness to the reader
criteria.evaluation_prompt: Evaluate how helpful and useful this response would be for someone seeking this information. Does it provide actionable insights?

criteria.name: coherence
criteria.description: Logical flow and consistency of ideas
criteria.evaluation_prompt: Assess the logical flow and coherence of ideas in the response. Are the arguments well-structured?

examples.5: Perfectly coherent with excellent logical flow

criteria.name: appropriateness
criteria.description: Suitability of tone, style, and content for academic context
criteria.evaluation_prompt: Evaluate whether the tone, style, and content are appropriate for an academic context. Is it professional and suitable?

examples.1: Inappropriate tone or content for academic context
examples.5: Perfectly appropriate and well-calibrated for academic use
